alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 24 at 5:36PM PST until November 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations 9 to 14 inches above 3000 feet and 5 to 10 inches below 3000 feet. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades, mainly above 3000 feet. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will create travel issues along Interstate 90 over Snoqualmie Pass and Highway 12 over White Pass. Holiday travelers need to make sure vehicles are equipped for heavy snow which include traction devices or tires, shovels and flashlights and may consider alternate plans.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
